intro: Apowollastonia, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. Apowollastonia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a symbol of Australian national identity. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade.
